src:
Mochamad Iriawan Jadi Ketua Umum PSSI 2019-2023
02 Nov 2019, 13:19 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Mochamad Iriawan terpilih menjadi ketua umum (ketum) PSSI periode 2019-2023. Pria yang akrab disapa Iwan Bule itu mengantongi 82 suara dari 85 voters dalam Kongres Luar Biasa (KLB) PSSI yang berlangsung di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta Pusat, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Sementara tiga suara dari tiga voters dianggap tidak sah. Sedangkan satu voters yang tidak menggunakan hak suaranya adalah kontestan Liga 2 yaitu Persis Solo.
Selain Iwan Bule, ada 10 calon ketum PSSI lainnya yaitu Fary Djemy Francis, Vijaya Fitriyasa, Yesayas Octavianus, Rahim Soekasah, Arief Putra Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Benny Erwin, Bernard Limbong, Sarman El Hakim, dan La Nyalla Mattalitti. Namun, nama terakhir sudah lebih dulu memutuskan untuk menarik diri karena merasa tanggal pelaksanaan KLB tidak sesuai dengan rekomendasi FIFA.
Setelah itu disusul oleh Bernard yang menyatakan mundur dari bursa pencalonan ketum. Dia menarik diri sejam sebelum KLB digelar.
Tak berhenti di Bernard, enam caketum lainnya yaitu Aven, Yesayas, Fary, Vijaya, Benny, dan Sarman juga memilih mundur dari KLB. Keenamnya memutuskan untuk menarik diri setelah diusir oleh petugas keamanan dari ruangan kongres.
Alhasil, kontestan caketum PSSI hanya menyisakan tiga kandidat setelah tujuh calon memutuskan mundur sebelum dan saat kongres berlangsung. Ketiga caketum tersebut adalah Iwan Bule, Rahim, dan Arif.
"Kongres Pemilihan PSSI dimenangkan Iwan Bule. Dia mendapatkan 82 suara, tiga suara tidak sah, dan satu voters tidak hadir," kata Rahim.
text:
Mochamad Iriawan Becomes Chairperson of PSSI 2019-2023
02 Nov 2019, 13:19 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Mochamad Iriawan was elected as the general chair of PSSI for the 2019-2023 period. The man who is familiarly called Iwan Bule pocketed 82 votes from 85 voters in the PSSI Extraordinary Congress (KLB) which took place at the Shangri-La Hotel, Central Jakarta, Saturday (11/02/2019).
While three votes from three voters are considered invalid. Meanwhile, one voter who did not use his vote was League 2 contestant, Persis Solo.
In addition to Iwan Bule, there were 10 other PSSI candidates including Fary Djemy Francis, Vijaya Fitriyasa, Yesayas Octavianus, Rahim Soekasah, Arief Putra Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Benny Erwin, Bernard Limbong, Sarman El Hakim, and La Nyalla Mattalitti. However, the last name had already been decided to withdraw because they felt the date of the KLB implementation was not in accordance with FIFA recommendations.
After that, it was followed by Bernard, who resigned from the Ketum nomination exchange. He withdrew an hour before the KLB was held.
Do not stop at Bernard, six other caketum namely Aven, Yesayas, Fary, Vijaya, Benny, and Sarman also chose to withdraw from KLB. The six decided to withdraw after being evicted by security officers from the congress room.
As a result, PSSI caketum contestants only left three candidates after seven candidates decided to resign before and during the congress. The three caketum are Iwan Bule, Rahim, and Arif.
"The PSSI Election Congress was won by Iwan Bule. He got 82 votes, three invalid votes, and one voter was absent," Rahim said.
